s2.ptxt: Install a new gasket and the water pump with the 8 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL TIMING CHAIN COVER (OIL PUMP ASSEMBLY)

s2.ptxt: Install 3 new O-rings to the timing chain cover as shown in the illustration.
Apply adhesive to the timing chain cover plug.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine adhesive 1324, three bond 1324 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Using a 10 mm socket hexagon wrench, install the timing chain cover plug.
Apply seal packing in a continuous line as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the timing chain cover within 3 minutes and tighten the bolts within 15 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Align the oil pump's drive rotor spline and crankshaft as shown in the illustration. Install the spline and chain cover plate to the crankshaft.
Loosely install the timing chain cover with the 19 bolts and 2 nuts, but do not tighten the bolts and nuts yet.
Excluding the bolts labeled A and C, tighten the bolts and nuts in this order: Area 1, Area 2 and Area 3.
Excluding the bolts labeled A, E and F, tighten the bolts and nuts in this order: Area 1, Area 3, Area 2.

torque.subtitle: for bolt C
for bolt B, D and nut

s2.ptxt: Tighten the bolts labeled A in this order: Area 2 and Area 3.
Tighten the bolt labeled F.
Tighten the bolts labeled E in Area 4.
Apply a light coat of engine oil to the O-ring of the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Install the connector to the connector bracket.
Attach the harness clamp.
Connect the sensor connector.
Apply seal packing in a continuous line as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the oil pan within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the oil pan with the 16 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 16 bolts and 2 nuts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket and the oil strainer with the bolt and 2 nuts.
Apply seal packing in a continuous line as shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the oil pan within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 4 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the oil pan with the 20 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 20 bolts and 2 nuts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket and the drain plug.
Align the pulley set key with the key groove of the pulley, and slide on the pulley.
Using SST, install a new crankshaft pulley bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not reuse the pulley bolt.

s2.ptxt: Apply a coat of engine oil to a new O-ring.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Install the 2 cover gaskets to the head cover.
Apply seal packing to the places shown in the illustration.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine seal packing block, three bond 1207B or equivalent

item.ptxt: Remove any oil from the contact surface.
Install the head cover within 3 minutes after applying seal packing.
Do not start the engine for at least 2 hours after the installation.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the head cover with the 19 bolts and 2 nuts.
Uniformly tighten the 19 bolts and 2 nuts in the order shown in the illustration.
In numerical order, confirm that the bolts labeled 1 to 8 are tightened to the torque specification. Tighten the bolts as necessary.
Install a new gasket and the No. 1 water by-pass pipe with the 2 nuts and bolt.
Install the spacer, idler pulley and pulley plate with the bolt.
Temporarily install the belt tensioner with the 3 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the flanges of the bolts are contacting the tensioner surface.

s2.ptxt: Install the tensioner by tightening the 3 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install a new gasket to the thermostat.

atten4.ptxt: When installing the thermostat to the gasket, be careful not to deform the gasket. Make sure that the thermostat is properly installed into the groove of the gasket, as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Insert the thermostat into the cylinder block with the jiggle valve facing straight upward.

atten4.ptxt: The jiggle valve may be set within 10° of either side of the prescribed position.

s2.ptxt: Install the inlet with the 2 nuts and bolt.
Connect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL COMPRESSOR MOUNTING BRACKET (w/ Air Conditioning System)

atten3.ptxt: Install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket exactly as described in the procedures below to properly secure and prevent damage to the fan and generator V belt.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket with the 3 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Temporarily install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket with the 3 bolts so that the bracket can be moved by hand.

s2.ptxt: Push the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket toward the cylinder block as shown in the illustration and tighten bolt B.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure there is no clearance between the cylinder block and No. 1 compressor mounting bracket as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Uniformly tighten the 4 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.
Install the generator with the 2 bolts.
Install the generator wire with the bolt and nut.
Attach the terminal cap.
Connect the connector.
Install a new gasket and the intake manifold with the 5 bolts and 2 nuts.
Connect the crankshaft position sensor to the clamp.
Install a new gasket on the intake manifold.

atten4.ptxt: Align the protrusion of the gasket with the groove of the intake manifold.

s2.ptxt: Install the throttle body with the 4 bolts.
Connect the 2 water by-pass hoses to the throttle body.
Connector the throttle position sensor and control motor connector.
Install the ignition coil with the bolt.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE ENGINE ASSEMBLY FROM ENGINE STAND

s2.ptxt: Install the engine to the vehicle (see page ).

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

s2.ptxt: Perform initialization (see page ).

atten3.ptxt: Certain systems need to be initialized after disconnecting and reconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

s2.ptxt: Clean and install the oil drain plug with a new gasket.
Add fresh engine oil.

entry.ptxt: Drain and refill with oil filter change
Drain and refill without oil filter change

s2.ptxt: Install the oil filler cap.
Tighten all the plugs and fill the radiator with TOYOTA Super Long Life Coolant (SLLC).

torqueitem.ptxt: for cylinder block drain cock plug

item.ptxt: TOYOTA vehicles are filled with TOYOTA SLLC at the factory. In order to avoid damage to the engine cooling system and other technical problems, only use TOYOTA SLLC or similar high quality ethylene glycol based non-silicate, non-amine, non-nitrite, non-borate coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology (coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology is a combination of low phosphates and organic acids).
Please contact your TOYOTA dealer for further details.

atten3.ptxt: Never use water as a substitute for engine coolant.

s2.ptxt: Fill the radiator reservoir with TOYOTA SLLC to the F line.
Press the inlet and outlet radiator hoses several times by hand, and then check the level of the coolant.
If the coolant level drops below the F line, add TOYOTA SLLC to the F line.
Install the radiator cap.
Bleed air from the cooling system.

s3.ptxt: Warm up the engine until the thermostat opens.
While the thermostat is open, circulate the coolant for several minutes.
Maintain the engine speed at 2,500 to 3,000 rpm.
Press the inlet and outlet radiator hoses several times by hand to bleed air.

item.ptxt: Wear protective gloves.
Be careful as the radiator hoses are hot.
Keep your hands away from the radiator fan.

s2.ptxt: Stop the engine and wait until the coolant cools down to ambient temperature.

atten2.ptxt: Do not remove the radiator cap while the engine and radiator are still hot. Pressurized, hot engine coolant and steam may be released and cause serious burns.

s2.ptxt: Check the coolant level in the radiator reservoir.
If the coolant level is below the L line, add SLLC up to the reservoir F line.
Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.

s3.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch ON.
Push the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Select the Active Test and enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Fuel Pump / Speed.

s2.ptxt: Check for fuel leaks.

s3.ptxt: Check that there are no fuel leaks after performing maintenance anywhere on the fuel system.

s2.ptxt: Start the engine, and check that there are no oil leaks after performing maintenance.
Check for engine coolant leaks (see page ).
Check the throttle control motor operating sound.

s3.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch ON.
When pressing the accelerator pedal, check the operating sound of the running motor. Make sure that no friction noises emit from the motor.
If friction noise is heard, replace the throttle body.

s2.ptxt: Check the throttle position sensor.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON.
Under Current Data, check that the throttle valve opening percentage (Throttle Pos) is within the standard.

atten3.ptxt: When checking the standard throttle valve opening percentage, the shift lever should be in the N position.

s3.ptxt: If the percentage is less than 60%, replace the throttle body.

s2.ptxt: Warm up the engine and stop the engine.

atten3.ptxt: A warmed up engine should have an engine coolant temperature of over 80°C (176°F), have an engine oil temperature of 60°C (140°F), and the engine rpm should be stabilized.

s2.ptxt: When using the intelligent tester:
Check the ignition timing.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Turn the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Enter the following items: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / IGN Advance.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester operator's manual for further details.

s2.ptxt: When not using the intelligent tester:
Check the ignition timing.

s3.ptxt: Using SST, connect a tachometer probe to terminal 9 (TAC) of the DLC3.

item.ptxt: Confirm the terminal numbers before connecting them. Connection with a wrong terminal can damage the engine.
Turn off all electrical systems before connecting the terminals.

s3.ptxt: Clamp the tester probe of a timing light to the 4 lead wires or green-red lead wire of the ignition coil connector of the No. 1 cylinder.
Start the engine.
Using SST, connect terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.

atten3.ptxt: When checking the ignition timing, the transmission should be in the neutral position.

item.ptxt: After connecting the terminals (TC and CG), the engine rpm changes to approximately 1,000 to 1,500 rpm for 5 seconds, then returns to the idle speed. This occurs because the ECM checks that the ISC (idle speed control system) is operating properly.
Perform the inspection of the ignition timing after the engine rpm is returned to idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Using a timing light, measure the ignition timing.
Remove SST from terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.
Check the ignition timing.
Confirm that the ignition timing moves to the advanced angle side when the engine speed is increased.
Remove the timing light.

s2.ptxt: Warm up and stop the engine.

atten3.ptxt: A warmed up engine should have an engine coolant temperature of over 80°C (176°F), have an engine oil temperature of 60°C (140°F), and the engine rpm should be stabilized.

s2.ptxt: When using the intelligent tester:
Check the idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester II operator's manual for further details.

s3.ptxt: Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Turn the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Enter the following items: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Engine SPD.

item.ptxt: When checking the idle speed, the transmission should be in the neutral position.
Switch off all accessories and air conditioning before connecting the intelligent tester.

s2.ptxt: When not using the intelligent tester:
Check the idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Using SST, connect a tachometer tester probe to terminal 9 (TAC) of the DLC3.
Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Check the idle speed.

s2.ptxt: Start and warm up the engine.
Run the engine at 2,500 rpm for approximately 180 seconds and idle the engine.
Insert CO/HC meter testing probe at least 40 cm (1.3 ft.) into the tailpipe.
Check CO/HC concentration at idle.
If the CO/HC concentration is not as specified, perform troubleshooting in the order given below.

s3.ptxt: Check the heated oxygen sensor operation (see page ).
See the table below for possible causes, and then inspect and repair the applicable causes if necessary.

item.ptxt: Faulty ignitions:
Incorrect timing
Plugs are contaminated, shorted or gaps are defective
Incorrect valve clearance
Leaks in intake and exhaust valves
Leaks in cylinders
Vacuum leaks:
Ventilation hoses
Intake manifold
Throttle body
Brake booster line
Lean mixture causing misfire
Restricted air filter
Plugged ventilation valve
Faulty SFI system:
Faulty pressure regulator
Defective ECT sensor
Defective Mass Air Flow (MAF) meter
Faulty ECM
Faulty injectors
Faulty throttle position sensor
